title: Local candidates face off on CBC Ottawa News at 6 | CBC News
text:
Four local candidates vying for a seat in the House of Commons made their pitch to voters live on CBC Thursday.

CBC Ottawa News at 6 held a debate tonight, hosted by Adrian Harewood and Lucy van Oldenbarneveld.

It featured:

Nepean Green candidate Jean-Luc Cooke.

Gatineau Liberal candidate Steve MacKinnon.

Carleton Conservative candidate Pierre Poilievre.

Ottawa Centre NDP candidate Emilie Taman.

The candidates answered questions from the audience that were submitted in the last few days, as well as ones that came in on Twitter and Facebook during the show.

You can rewatch tonight's debate in the embedded video player.

CBC TV's coverage on election night will start at 6:30 p.m. ET Monday and CBC Radio's coverage starts at 7 p.m. ET.

CBC Ottawa will have full digital coverage as the results come in.
description: Four local candidates vying for a seat in the House of Commons made their pitch to voters live on CBC Thursday.
